summary: The minutes document the first meeting of the incorporators of Mort, Inc., held in the U.S. Virgin Islands. Key decisions included the election of a Board of Directors and the adoption of bylaws for the corporation. Notable individuals present included William S. McConnell, Denise J. Richards, and Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: William S. McConnell
persons.context: William S. McConnell called the meeting to order and was elected as Chairman.

persons.name: Denise J. Richards
persons.context: Denise J. Richards was elected as Secretary and acknowledged the accuracy of the minutes.

persons.name: Michelle Connor
persons.context: Michelle Connor was present as one of the incorporators of Mort, Inc.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein was elected as a Director of Mort, Inc.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Darren Indyke was elected as a Director of Mort, Inc.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.context: Richard Kahn was elected as a Director of Mort, Inc.

connections.description: William S. McConnell served as Chairman while Denise J. Richards served as Secretary during the meeting.
Both Jeffrey Epstein and Darren Indyke were elected as Directors of Mort, Inc.
Both Jeffrey Epstein and Richard Kahn were elected as Directors of Mort, Inc.
Both Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn were elected as Directors of Mort, Inc.

events.title: First Meeting of Incorporators of Mort, Inc.
events.description: The first meeting of the incorporators of Mort, Inc. was held, where the Articles of Incorporation were presented and a Board of Directors was elected.

locations: Law House, 1000 Frederiksberg Gade, Charlotte Amalie, St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands
keyFacts: The meeting was held on April 12, 2011, at the offices of Dudley, Topper and Feuerzeig.
William S. McConnell was elected as Chairman and Denise J. Richards as Secretary of the meeting.
The Articles of Incorporation were filed on the same day as the meeting.
Jeffrey Epstein, Darren Indyke, and Richard Kahn were elected as Directors of Mort, Inc.
Bylaws for the corporation were adopted during the meeting.
